definitions.definition: To indicate ; to convey or communicate by a signal.
examples: I signalled my acquiescence with a nod.
He whistled to signal that we should stop.

definitions.definition: To communicate with (a person or system) by a signal.
examples: Seeing the flames, he ran to the control room and signalled headquarters.

main_definition: ( ambitransitive ) To indicate ; to convey or communicate by a signal.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To communicate with (a person or system) by a signal.
